creator: venket.raman@bankofamerica.com
text:
I have a Java Class which has two other inner classes. When i used the 
build.bat it gives an error about using the reference to the static inner 
class. I tried compiling the class directly with the Javac it works perfectly. 
But when invoked frm the build process fails.

Sounds as if Ant would use javac of JDK 1.1 while your command line javac is from
a newer version.

This may very well happen, depending on the content of your build.bat - is this
batch file setting JAVA_HOME to something strange or including classes.zip in
the CLASSPATH where it shouldn't or starting a different version of Java than you
expect?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
umagesh@rediffmail.com
text: Did you get this resolved?  Let us know so that we can close this case.

creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
No user feedback.  Guess Stefan's hint helped solve this issue for him.
Closing this report as invalid.

I am encountering a similar problem.

If I build my source tree fresh (i.e.. no existing class files) everything is
built. If the compile fails, I then fix the issue and then rebuild some inner
classes fail to get built, despite ant reporting that everything has compiled ok.

I am running ant v1.4.1
creator: paul.smith@uk.appl.net

text:
Paul,

Your problem is not the same, I believe since it sounds like you have problems
with the Ant javac task rebuild checks. I'm going to close this issue again and
if you believe you still have a problem, could you please raise a new report and
provide more information about your build setup and the failures you encounter.
creator: conor@apache.org
